dismissalText.long: c Tamim Iqbal b Shoriful Islam
dismissalText.commentary: Wessly Madhevere c Tamim Iqbal b Shoriful Islam 56 (63b 5x4 1x6 83m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: slower ball, outside off and angling away. Tries to slap it over cover, but the ball goes straight up in the air since he's through the shot too early. Tamim at long off runs in, and dives forward to take a difficult catch. End of a very useful innings

image.longCaption: Shoriful Islam player portrait

headshotImage.caption: Shoriful Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shoriful Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor hit wicket b Shoriful Islam 46 (57b 5x4 1x6 79m) SR: 80.7

dismissalComment.html: back of a length, on off. Tries to ramp it over the cordon but makes no connection. But is he out caught? The umpires are checking something. What's happening here. Is it Taylor getting an edge or something else? Oh dear. It's not caught behind but hit wicket! After missing the ramp, Taylor swung his bat in a nonchalant way like one tries to shadow practice a shot, and that has clipped the stump as the bat went behind him. The curse of the nelson? Bizarre way to get out.

dismissalComment.html: lobbed up, and caught at long-on! And much like it has happened before, a wicket falls just after the drinks break. Shortish length on off, and he rocks back to pull that on to the leg side, but gets it straight to long-on, where Mahmudullah bends low to grab that

dismissalText.long: c Afif Hossain b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Kamunhukamwe c Afif Hossain b Taskin Ahmed 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: nabbed at point! Slightly short of a length and outside off, as Kamunhukamwe plays the cut again only to find the fielder as the ball was hit aerially and right where Afif was positioned. A probing over for the opener eventually ends in his dismissal, as Bangladesh strike in the first over

dismissalComment.html: another diving catch, and another Bangladesh wicket falls. This time it is Madhevere at cover-point, who dives to his left to nab that. Good length ball bowled wide of off, and Mithun plays away from the body only to push that aerially toward the fielder

commentPreTextItems.html: Muzarabani has to defend 3 in the last over

commentTextItems.html: punched to third man, and there comes the win. Opens the bat face to this good length ball outside off, and places it to the right of point and beyond the third man fielder's left. With that, Bangladesh take the match and the series

commentPostTextItems.html: An exciting finish in the end. The experience of Shakib and the maturity of Saifuddin made all the difference, but don't forget the four wickets by Shoriful, which helped restrict Zimbabwe to 240. And the hosts - like in the Test and the first ODI - had their moments, but couldn't capitalise on them. Too many extras didn't help either. But anyway, catch us for the final game with Zimbabwe seeking crucial Super League points, if not the series. Until then, it's a goodbye from Chandan, Ranjith, Sreshth and me, Himanshu!
joynul: "Experience, the difference between these two teams today was just Experience."

Tamim, the winning captain: "Restricting them to 240 was a decent job by the bowlers. We definitely had some plans, and as a batting team, we could have done better. They way Shakib and Saifuddin batted was nice to see."

Shakib is the Player of the Match for his 2 for 42 and 96*: "Today was the day I had to put my hands up. Very happy... Lot of credit to Saifuddin, he showed a lot of composure. Today the wicket was slower. If the bowlers were bowling straight into the wicket, you had to take chances, which is where we lost wickets."

Here's Taylor after a close loss for his side: "Much improved performance, but Bangladesh didn't look like panicking and held their nerve. There are fine lines you talk about.. hope the last game goes our way."
Shapla: "Everyone talking about Shakib while Saifuddin made a good contribution "
Jack: "Zimbabwe only have themselves to blame with this loss after giving away all those wides."

5.17pm It was a very calm knock from an experienced Shakib, and he eventually takes his side home. Not dissimilar to MS Dhoni's finishing: never fussed for boundaries, happy to keep rotating the strike when required and finding gaps for crucial runs to complete the chase. He finishes just four short of a hundred, but will be pleased to have done the job.

commentTextItems.html: inside edge for four to the left of short fine leg, and that may be it. Made room to this very full on off, and went for the drive to the off side. But he gets an inside edge to instead pocket four to fine leg

commentTextItems.html: good yorker on middle and off, and dragged to point after making room
comes down and exposes his stumps. The bowler follows him to go on a good length wide of leg, as it is tucked to square leg
slower ball on a full length on off, and his push to the man at cover means it's a dot for Zimbabwe
very full and straighter on off. Dug out to extra cover from deep in his crease
short of a length outside off and slammed to mid-off, who throws at the bowler's end. Jongwe seemed to have hurt himself there, but looks fine now

commentPreTextItems.html: 12 to win from 12 balls. Still anybody's game
Ruhak: "Excellent presence of mind showed by Shakib for that 3rd run there. These always matter! "

commentTextItems.html: slower ball on a full length down the leg, and that's another wide with the batter going across to let that go
change of pace on a full length on leg, as the ball trickles to the off side. He missed his flick, and there was a leg-before appeal. But the ball was always sliding down leg there

commentTextItems.html: shortish length on off, and cut to deep point. Shakib into the 90s

Jongwe at third man runs to his left, and throws to the bowler's end but the batters still sneak a third with the boundary being longer there. He just glanced this good length ball on off, and they always wanted the third
short, and a slower ball on middle and leg. He swivels with this pull, but that's gone straight to fine leg
full and pretty wide of off. Shakib tries to slash at that away going ball, and it's another wide
uppishly pushed to mid-off, but just short. Came down to this good length ball on off, and tried to slice but got it from higher on the bat

commentPreTextItems.html: Long-off now in, and mid-on drops back to long-on

commentTextItems.html: good bounce and just past the outside edge. Good length delivery on middle, and angles away a touch as he tries to poke but is beaten

commentPreTextItems.html: Man at square leg inside the circle, and one at short fine leg too

commentTextItems.html: taps this full ball on middle to point, while the ball also angles in. He wants a single, but is sent back

dismissalComment.html: back of a length, on off. Tries to ramp it over the cordon but makes no connection. But is he out caught? The umpires are checking something. What's happening here. Is it Taylor getting an edge or something else? Oh dear. It's not caught behind but hit wicket! After missing the ramp, Taylor swung his bat in a nonchalant way like one tries to shadow practice a shot, and that has clipped the stump as the bat went behind him. The curse of the nelson? Bizarre way to get out.

image.caption: Brendan Taylor
image.longCaption: Brendan Taylor

headshotImage.caption: BRM Taylor headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: BRM Taylor headshot

dismissalComment.html: back of a length, on off. Tries to ramp it over the cordon but makes no connection. But is he out caught? The umpires are checking something. What's happening here. Is it Taylor getting an edge or something else? Oh dear. It's not caught behind but hit wicket! After missing the ramp, Taylor swung his bat in a nonchalant way like one tries to shadow practice a shot, and that has clipped the stump as the bat went behind him. The curse of the nelson? Bizarre way to get out.
